price - a) the amount of money or goods for which a thing is bought or sold; b) value or worth. ಕ್ರಯ ಕೊಡು kraya koḍu to pay the price (for a thing purchased); ಕ್ರಯಕ್ಕೆ ಕೊಡು krayakke koḍu to sell (something) for a price; ಕ್ರಯ ಮಾಡು kraya māḍu to get by paying or agreeing to pay money or some equivalent; to purchase; to buy.
to purchase (something) for a price.
a document evidencing a sale.
a purchaser - a) a man who acquires or aims to acquire possessions; b) a person who purchases something for money; a buyer.
a list of current prices of items on sale; a price list.
(pl.) the transactions or instances of buying and selling.
a man who buys and sells; a trader; a merchant.
a person's financial ability to make purchases.
the amount that a sum of money etc. can purchase.
= ಕ್ರಯದಾರ.
a thing kept for sale.

raw flesh of animals.
a flesh-eating man; a demon.
any carnivorous animal.
gone; passed; crossed (over to another side).
the act of moving, walking, etc.
(dance.) one of the nine sitting postures, keeping the hands on the chin and the head on the shoulder blade (as in shedding tears, expressing grief).
(dance.) one of the ten movements of the feet; a moving in a circle keeping one foot after another differently off the ground.
the supposed ability to perceive things that are not in sight or that cannot be seen.
a man with such ability.
= ಕ್ರಾಂತದರ್ಶನ - 2.

= ಕ್ರಾಂತದರ್ಶನ - 1.
the act of moving, going, advancing.
any hostile offensive action, esp. with armed forces; an onslaught; an attack; an invasion.
the actual or imaginary path taken by a celestial body during its periodic revolution around another body.
a complete or radical change of any kind.
a large scale movement that can overthrow or has overthrown a government; a revolution.
any revival of art, literature or learning.
a woman whoworks for, characterised by, favours a revolution in a government or social system; a revolutionary woman.
a woman bringing or causing to bring, about great or radical change.
a man who favours, instigates, advocates or takes part in a revolution; a man bringing or causing to bring, about great or radical change.
pertaining to, characterised by or of the nature of revolution; involving or constituting radical change; pertaining to or advocating political revolution; revolutionary.

= ಕ್ರಾಂತಿಕಾರ.
the period of passing from one condition, form, stage, activity, place, etc. to another.
the period of a political or social revolution.
a person who favours, instigates, advocates or takes part in a revolution; a person bringing or causing to bring, about great or radical change.
a group of persons or a party who intend or work for radical changes in political or social systems; a revolutionary party; leftists.
the actual or imaginary path taken by a celestial body during its periodic revolution around another body; an orbit.
the course of a revolutionary or revolutionaries.
the period of a political or social revolution.
the period of great changes (as in art, literature, etc.).

a cutting short of the hair of a person.
a person who buys; a purchaser; a buyer.
the doing of something; action.
an act or thing done.
behaviour; habitual conduct.
habitual activity characterised by energy and boldness.
a usual method or custom; convention; practice.
religious, ceremonial act, rite, etc.; observance.
any act of reparation, self-punishment, etc. done in repentance for a sin or wrongdoing; penance.
= ಕ್ರಿಯಾಜ್ಞಾನ.
the tree Betula alba of Betulaceae family, having smooth bark easily peeled off in thin sheets, and hard, close-grained wood; Indian birch tree.

any of several small arthropod animals of the class Insecta, characterised, in the adult state, by division of the body into head, thorax, and abdomen, three pairs of legs on the thorax, and, usu., two pairs of membranous wings.
(gen.) any small arthropod, usu. wingless, including spiders, centipedes, pill bugs, and mites.
a resinous substance secreted by various scale insects, esp. by a species (Laccifer lacca, that live on certain fig, soapberry, and acacia trees; lac.
(fig.) an abject, wretched or contemptible person.
(myth.) name of a hell.
(zool.) a category in the classification of animals, that covers a large class of insecticides; family of insecticides.
the creeper Erycibe paniculata (var. Wightiana) of Convulvulaceae.
anything (as a disease) that is caused by insects, worms, etc.
the fine, soft, shiny fibre produced by silkworms to form their cocoons; silk.
a tooth having caries; a carious tooth.
that kills insects; insecticidal.
any substance used to kill insects; an insecticide.
= ಕ್ರಿಮಿನಾಶಕ1.
= ಕ್ರಿಮಿನಾಶಕ2; 2) the plant Chrysanthemum cinerariaefolium ( = Pyrethrum cinerariae folium) of Asteraceae family.
the plant Derris scandens of Papilionaceae family; hog creeper.
the plant Derris uliginosa of the same family.
the plant Drosera indica of Droseraceae family, having leaves covered with adhesive hairs that trap insects, which are digested by the plant; sundew plant.
the plant akin to sundew plant, Drosera burmanni of Droseraceae family, having leaves covered with adhesive hairs that trap insects, which are digested by the plant.
the dark red colour of lac.
any disease or disorder caused by the presence of parasitic worms in the intestines, etc.; worms.
(said of wood and wood articles) eaten away, rendered strengthless by any of a family Bostrychiacae (order Coleopotera) of insects.
the branch of zoology that deals with insects; entomology.
(masc.) a specialist in entomology, the branch of zoology that deals with insects; entomologist.
(fem.) a specialist in entomology, the branch of zoology that deals with insects; entomologist.
the act of making something free from living micro organisms, as by subjecting to great heat or chemical action; sterilisation.
a host of insects, worms, etc.
(myth.) name of a hell.
the act of killing, destroying insects.
